section.title: Navigation Bar
section.para: The Editor allows the ability to modify content, create content, view content, create versions, and export content. One of the areas to access these functions is in the Navigation Bar.

mediaobject.alt: Figure of the Knowledge Editor navigation displaying the Editor logo, and menu options for Projects, Export Management, Authoring, Manager, and User name Admin

section.para:
The Navigation Bar provides the following options:
Projects - If your account has more than one project assigned, switch between them by selecting this menu item.
Shortcuts - Used for multiple actions that can be found in tab-specific areas of the application.
Manager - This option displays for Content Managers, and Administrators and takes the user to the Knowledge Manager Homepage. This option is not visible to Read-Only and Edit-Only users.
User - The menu under the user's name provides the ability to update global settings, manage account, find application help, and to log out.

section.title: Projects
section.para: The Projects Menu displays all of the projects that a user is assigned to. The user can switch between projects with this menu option as long as there is more than one project assigned, and the Knowledge environment they are working in has more than one project defined. The default is to have one project per Knowledge instance.

section.title: Shortcuts
section.para:
The Shortcuts sub-menu provides a quick way for the user to access certain actions including:
Create a version – displays the create a version modal. This option is only visible to users with content manager permissions and above.
Export content – displays the export content modal.
New concept – to create a new concept.
New map set – to create a new map set.
New value set – to create a new value set.
Run classifier – performs a classification run.
Run QA test – performs a quality assurance check.
Shortcuts Menu
All of these actions can be performed by going through the shortcut menu or through features within specific tabs Task Pane, refer to .

section.title: Manager
section.para: The Manager option is only available to an Administrator or System Manager administrator. When selected, the user will be taken to the Knowledge Manager area. Here, a user with the appropriate permissions can modify user accounts, create new accounts, etc. For more details refer to

section.title: Username Menu
section.para:
The menu under the user's name provides the ability to modify global settings, manage your account, view the user guide, request technical support, and log out of the application, .
Global Display Settings – contains filters and customizations for what is displayed throughout the user interface.
Manage Account – enables a user to modify their user profile.
Help – user documentation for Knowledge.
Contact Technical Support – send a technical support request.
Logout – signs you out of Knowledge.

section.title: Global Display Settings
section.para:
When a user is created, the display options are configured with default settings. A user can modify the display settings using the Global Display Settings
The following options in the Global Display Settings panel are not fully implemented and will not be documented here: Module Flags, Path Flags, Value Set Flag. It is recommended that users ONLY modify settings that are documented in this section. panel. Changes to the display settings in the Global Display Settings panel affects the displayed information in both the Task Pane and the Concept Viewer Pane, refer to . However, the Concept Viewer Pane and the Task Pane can override the Global Display Settings using the Display Options located in the top right hand corner of each pane. The configurable options in Global Display Settings are:
General Options – a user can change the order in which the descriptions are displayed in the taxonomy view and the number of concepts displayed in the taxonomy.
Display Options – a user can configure the properties displayed, stated or inferred views of the taxonomy, and modules.

section.title: General Options
section.para: In the default configuration, FQN is the preferred description to display in the taxonomy. The taxonomy will display 250 child concepts per concept (additional concepts are available through pagination) and the default language is set to English. See outlined in red.

section.title: Display Options
section.para: Similar to General Options, the Display Options are set to default settings when a user's account is created (see areas circled in red). These options mostly effect the views in the Concept Viewer and the Taxonomy.

example.title: Display Inactive Descriptions
example.para: To show inactive descriptions in the Concept Viewer and Taxonomy, deselect the Show Only Active Concepts checkbox, and select Apply changes. Inactive descriptions are italicized in the application.

section.title: Manage Account
section.para:
A user can modify their account profile by selecting Manage Account. From there, the Edit Profile is presented, see . A user can modify their email address, User Name, Display Name, and password. To save changes to your profile, select the Save button. To return to the Knowledge Editor, select your user menu at the top right, select Home, then select Editor button.
The System Token is needed only by Software Developers.

section.title: Help
section.para: Selecting Help will open the User Documentation for Knowledge.

section.title: Contact Technical Support
section.para: Selecting Contact Technical Support will bring the user to a web-page where they can send their question and describe their issue to our technical support team, . An email response will be sent to the user as soon as possible.
